main event: A man reported seeing a bright, stationary object in the sky near Dewitt, Arkansas on April 13, 1966 around 12:04 AM.
interesting points: The object appeared to be as high as the cloud cover and very bright and steady, like a bright star.
The object was visible for about 20 minutes before being obscured by clouds.
After sunrise, the object was no longer visible, likely due to the increased cloud cover.
The witness was a civilian and geologist who had past experience as a cryptographer in the Army Security Agency.
The witness reported the sighting to the U.S. Air Force, who requested additional information to evaluate the report.
sighted object: a bright, stationary object in the sky
